alert.note: Alert for Hill (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 19 at 6:24PM CDT until May 19 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Hill County in Central Texas * WHEN...Until 845 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will likely cause urban and small stream flooding. Low lying and/or poor drainage areas will experience minor flooding in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hillsboro, Whitney, Itasca, Laguna Park, Blum, Covington, Bynum, Carl`s Corner, Aquilla Lake, Lake Whitney State Park, Lake Whitney, Retreat, Abbott, Aquilla, Woodbury, Mayfield, Peoria, Osceola, Lovelace and Brandon.
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
